df['Date']=pd.to_datetime(df['Date'], infer_datetime_format=True)

Day=df['Date'].dt.day_name()
Month=df['Date'].dt.month_name()
Year=df['Date'].dt.year

source.3ad9e735:
ct_counts = df.groupby(['Country ', 'Month']).size()
ct_counts = ct_counts.reset_index(name='count')
ct_counts = ct_counts.pivot(index = 'Country ', columns = 'Month', values = 'count')
ct_counts.head()

source.ef2c8eda:
plt.figure(figsize=(13,7))
sns.countplot(data=df,y='Country ',color='darkblue',order=country_order)
plt.title('Popular country to work in')
plt.xlabel('No.jobs')
plt.ylabel('Country')
source.4cdea41f:
plt.figure(figsize=(13,9))
job_counts = df.groupby(['Domain', 'Country ']).size()
job_counts = job_counts.reset_index(name='count')
job_counts = job_counts.pivot(index = 'Domain', columns = 'Country ', values = 'count')
sns.heatmap(job_counts, annot = True, cmap =   sns.diverging_palette(210,374, as_cmap=True), center = 6.7,
           cbar_kws = {'label' : 'No.Jobs'})
plt.xticks(rotation=15)
plt.title('Jobs per country')
plt.xlabel('Country')
plt.ylabel('Job')

source.d8b2fbfd:
Selected hourly rates per different analytics domains.  
The aim of the analysis is to see which domain is better paid and more needed. Data is a selection of hourly rated from freelancing sites and from people that agreed to disclose their hourly rate.
